intro: Aegiphila velutinosa, commonly known as velvetleaf aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Aegiphila velutinosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
